meanings.definition: Burn (someone) with hot liquid or steam.
meanings.sent1: Be careful, the hot water can scalds you.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally scalds herself while cooking pasta.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat scalds the unsuspecting dog with a splash of hot tea.
meanings.sent4: The harsh criticism scalds her fragile confidence.
meanings.sent5: The scorching sun scalds the earth, leaving it parched and cracked.

meanings.definition: Injure with very hot liquid or steam.
meanings.sent1: The steam from the kettle scalds his hand.
meanings.sent2: The chef scalds his arm on the hot oven.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter scalds the customer with a spilled cup of coffee.
meanings.sent4: Her words scald his heart more than any physical pain.
meanings.sent5: The volcanic eruption scalds everything in its path with searing heat.

meanings.definition: A burn or injury caused by hot liquid or steam.
meanings.sent1: She had to treat the scalds on her arm from the boiling water.
meanings.sent2: The child cried in pain from the scalds on his legs.
meanings.sent3: The scalds on the table showed where the hot pot had been placed.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like a scald from her harsh rejection.
meanings.sent5: The scalds on the forest floor were evidence of the recent wildfire.
